cooking_method: Boil spaghetti until al dente. In a separate pan, cook bacon and garlic. In a bowl, whisk together eggs and parmesan cheese. Drain spaghetti and add to the bacon pan. Turn off heat, add egg mixture and stir until sauce thickens. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 450°F. Roll out pizza dough and add tomato sauce. Tear fresh mozzarella and add to pizza. Top with basil leaves and drizzle with olive oil. Bake in oven for 10-15 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Brown ground beef and mix with tomato sauce. In a separate bowl, mix ricotta cheese with salt and pepper. Layer lasagna noodles, ground beef mixture, ricotta cheese mixture, and mozzarella cheese in a baking dish. Bake in oven at 375°F for 25-30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Mix espresso and rum in a bowl. Dip ladyfingers in mixture and layer in a baking dish. In a separate bowl, mix mascarpone cheese and sugar until smooth. Spread mixture over ladyfingers. Repeat layers. Dust cocoa powder on top. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.

1. Cook pasta according to package directions. 
2. In a food processor, pulse together basil, garlic, pine nuts, and parmesan cheese. 
3. Slowly add olive oil until a smooth pesto sauce is formed. 
4. Toss cooked pasta with the pesto sauce. 
5. Serve hot.

1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 
2. Slice baguette into thin slices and place on a baking sheet. 
3. Brush the slices with olive oil and bake in the oven for 5-7 minutes, until lightly toasted. 
4. In a bowl, mix together diced tomatoes, minced garlic, and chopped basil. 
5. Top the toasted baguette slices with the tomato mixture. 
6. Serve immediately.

1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. 
2. Add diced onion, carrots, and celery to the pot and sauté until softened. 
3. Add minced garlic and sauté for an additional minute. 
4. Add diced tomatoes and enough water or broth to cover the vegetables. 
5. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 20-30 minutes. 
6. Serve hot.

1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. 
2. Add diced onion to the pot and sauté until softened. 
3. Add arborio rice to the pot and stir to coat with the oil. 
4. Add white wine and stir until it is absorbed. 
5. Add hot broth or water, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly until the liquid is absorbed before adding more. 
6. Continue adding liquid and stirring until the rice is cooked through but still has a slightly firm center, about 18-20 minutes. 
7. Stir in parmesan cheese and butter until melted and combined. 
8. Serve hot.

1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. 
2. In a separate pan, cook pancetta until crispy. 
3. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, pecorino romano cheese, and black pepper. 
4. Once spaghetti is cooked, drain and add to the pan with the pancetta. 
5. Remove the pan from the heat and add the egg mixture, stirring quickly to coat the spaghetti. 
6. Serve immediately.

1. Preheat oven to 450°F. 
2. Stretch the pizza dough into a circle and place on a pizza pan. 
3. Spread tomato sauce over the pizza dough. 
4. Add slices of fresh mozzarella cheese. 
5. Drizzle with olive oil. 
6. Bake in the oven for 10-12 minutes, until the crust is golden brown. 
7. Top with fresh basil leaves. 
8. Serve hot.

1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 
2. Coat chicken breasts in breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan cheese. 
3. Place chicken breasts in a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes. 
4. Top with marinara sauce and slices of mozzarella cheese. 
5. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly. 
6. Serve hot.

1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 
2. Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. 
3. Brown ground beef in a pan. 
4. Spread a layer of marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish. 
5. Add a layer of cooked lasagna noodles. 
6. Spread a layer of ricotta cheese over the noodles. 
7. Add a layer of ground beef and marinara sauce. 
8. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of mozzarella cheese. 
9. Bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly. 
10. Serve hot.

1. Cook fettuccine pasta according to package directions. 
2. In a separate pan, melt butter and add minced garlic. 
3. Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. 
4. Stir in grated parmesan cheese until the sauce is smooth. 
5. Drain the pasta and add to the pan with the sauce. 
6. Toss the pasta in the sauce until it is well coated. 
7. Serve hot with additional parmesan cheese and black pepper if desired.

1. Preheat oven to 400°F. 
2. Slice baguette into 1/2-inch thick rounds. 
3. Toast the bread in the oven for 5-7 minutes, until golden brown. 
4. Cut plum tomatoes into small pieces and place in a bowl. 
5. Add minced garlic, chopped fresh basil leaves, and balsamic vinegar. 
6. Spoon the tomato mixture onto the toasted bread slices. 
7. Serve immediately.

1. Brew espresso coffee and mix with marsala wine. 
2. Dip ladyfingers into the coffee mixture, making sure they are well coated. 
3. Place a layer of the soaked ladyfingers in a dish. 
4. Spread a layer of mascarpone cheese over the ladyfingers. 
5. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of mascarpone cheese on top. 
6. Dust the top with cocoa powder. 
7. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

1. Heat olive oil in a pot. 
2. Add diced onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened. 
3. Add canned tomatoes and their juice. 
4. Add chicken or vegetable broth and bring to a boil. 
5. Add rinsed and drained cannellini beans. 
6. Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. 
7. Serve hot.

1. Cook penne pasta according to package directions. 
2. In a food processor, blend fresh basil leaves, minced garlic, pine nuts, and grated parmesan cheese until smooth. 
3. Slowly pour in olive oil while blending until a smooth pesto sauce forms. 
4. Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the pesto sauce. 
5. Toss the pasta in the sauce until it is well coated. 
6. Serve hot with additional parmesan cheese if desired.

1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 
2. Season the veal shanks with salt and pepper. 
3. Heat a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Add the veal shanks and sear until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove from the pot and set aside. 
4. Add the onion, carrot, and celery to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 
5. Add the garlic and tomato paste and cook for another minute. 
6. Deglaze the pot with white wine, scraping up any browned bits. 
7. Add the beef broth, lemon zest, bay leaves, and thyme. Stir to combine. 
8. Return the veal shanks to the pot, making sure they are fully submerged in the liquid. 
9. Cover the pot with a lid and transfer to the oven. Cook for 2-3 hours, until the meat is very tender. 
10. Remove the pot from the oven and discard the bay leaves and thyme sprigs. 
11. Serve the osso buco with gremolata (a mixture of lemon zest, parsley, and garlic) sprinkled on top.

1. Soak the porcini mushrooms in hot water for 15-20 minutes, then drain and chop them. 
2. In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add the chopped shallot and garlic and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes. 
3. Add the arborio rice and stir to coat in the butter. 
4. Add white wine and stir until the liquid is absorbed. 
5. Add the chopped porcini mushrooms and chicken broth, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly and waiting for each addition to be absorbed before adding more. 
6. Continue stirring and adding broth until the rice is cooked through and creamy, about 20-25 minutes. 
7. Remove from heat and stir in grated parmesan cheese. 
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 
9. Serve hot.

Boil spaghetti until al dente. In a separate pan, cook bacon and garlic. In a bowl, whisk together eggs and parmesan cheese. Drain spaghetti and add to the bacon pan. Turn off heat, add egg mixture and stir until sauce thickens. Add salt and pepper to taste.
